result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan P Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: PRETRIAL INCARCERATION CREDIT

Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive with any other setnence, with credit for 0 days served. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by the agent.
- No contact with any Pick N' Save stores.
- Obtain/maintain employment/school or a combination of both.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent.  Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment subject to tax intercept to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.

Defendant Jonathan P Lewis in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Court ordered Defendant held in the Milwaukee County Jail until turned over to Justice Point.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save Milwaukee County.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jonathan P Lewis in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Jonathan P Lewis in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan P Lewis in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Case called at 3:30, defendant failing to appear.  On State's motion, Court ordered a bench warrant to issue and bail forfeited.  Case recalled at 3:51:32.  Defendant appearing.  Statements from defense counsel as to why defendant appeared late.  Court withdraws bench warrant and reinstates bail.  Defense requests another plea and sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
